articles.title: Argentines Say Vegetables Cost as Much as Jewelry as Inflation Hit 94.8%in 2022
articles.description: Argentina registered inflation of 94.8 percent in 2022, its highest annual figure since 1991, the Indec national statistics institute said on Thursday. Latin America's third-largest economy has one of the highest inflation rates in the world. But December's monthly figure of 5.1 percent continued a general downward trend since a peak of 7.4 percent in July

articles.title: Argentina's inflation rate at 95%, highest since 1991
articles.description: Argentina's annual inflation hit its highest rate in more than 30 years last month as prices almost doubled versus a year ago, official data released on Thursday showed, further eroding consumers' dwindling purchasing power.
articles.content: BUENOS AIRES, Jan 12 (Reuters) - Argentina's annual inflation hit its highest rate in more than 30 years last month as prices almost doubled versus a year ago, official data released on Thursday showed, further eroding consumers' dwindling purchasing... [1864 chars]

articles.title: Argentine govt calls Congress to discuss Supreme Court impeachments
articles.description:
Argentina's government will convene extraordinary sessions of Congress to discuss the impeachment of members of the Supreme Court of Justice among other bills, the presidential spokeswoman said on Thursday.
Gabriela Cerruti, the presidential spokesperson, told a news conference the sessions would run from Jan. 23 to Feb. 28.

articles.title: Cris MJ, Standly Score First No. 1 on Argentina Hot 100
articles.description: Cris MJ and Standly score their first No. 1 on the Argentina Hot 100 chart as “Marisola” lifts 2-1. Get the details.
articles.content: Chileans Cris MJ and Standly cross off a career milestone with their first No. 1 on the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 chart (dated Jan. 7). “Marisola,” with Duki and Nicki Nicole, jumps 2-1 in its 19th week. It’s the longest trek to No. 1 since Rauw Al... [1220 chars]

articles.title: UPDATE 1-Argentine 2022/23 soybean harvest estimate cut to 41 mln tonnes -Buenos Aires exchange
articles.description: (Adds details, quote from exchange's report)BUENOS AIRES, Jan 12 (Reuters) - Argentina's soybean harvest for the 2022/23 cycle is estimated at 41 million tonnes, the Buenos Aires grains exchange said on Thursday, down from the 48 million tonnes previously estimated, after agricultural areas were hit by drought.Argentina is the world's leading exporter of processed soybean oil

articles.title: Argentina has opened its doors to Hinduism: Ambassador
articles.description: “Argentina takes pride in its capacity to develop and foster interreligious dialogue and in its respect for all creeds and beliefs" said Gobbi on the occasion of ‘BAPS Akshardham Day’ at the centennial celebration of Pramukh Swami Maharaj Shatabdi Mahotsav.
articles.content:
Argentina has opened its doors to Hinduism which has enriched its diversity and spirituality, said Hugo Javier Gobbi, Ambassador of Argentina to India, in Ahmedabad Thursday.

articles.title: Cristiano Ronaldo left off FIFA award list headed by Messi, Mbappe
articles.description: Aside from Messi, the only member of Argentina’s World Cup-winning team to make the list of nominees is forward Julián Álvarez.
articles.content:
Cristiano Ronaldo was left off the the 14-player shortlist for the annual Best FIFA Men’s Player award for the first time, with Lionel Messi and Kylian Mbappé among those selected.

articles.title: Argentina soy, corn harvest outlooks slashed due to drought - U.S. government
articles.description: CHICAGO, Jan 12 (Reuters) - Soybean and corn harvests in key global supplier Argentina will be smaller than previously estimated due to a crop wasting drought, the U.S. government said on Thursday.Soybean production for the 2022/23 marketing year was pegged at 45.50 million tonnes while corn production was seen at 52.00 million tonnes, the U.S. Agriculture Department said in
